_header: Of them that written us tofore
Note: See 4226 for the A Text, 4227 for the B Text, and 4229 for fragments.
_description: John Gower, Confessio Amantis, C Text — in eight Books and a Prologue: the longest version has about 34,000 lines

                    þerfore…
BodFair3.Last Lines:
…Wher resteþ loue and alle pesOur ioie mai ben
                    endeles

BodHat51.First Lines:
Torpor hebes sensus scola par|ua minimusque …Of hem that wryten vs to forThe bookes dwelle & we
                    therfor…
BodHat51.Last Lines:
…
                    That oold grysel is no foole

BodHat51.Note: An incomplete copy, ending VIII.2408 at bottom of second column, recto, of last folio (205rb), because this last leaf is bound backwards. Copied from Caxton’s text.

OxfWad13.First Lines:
Off hem that writen vs to foreThe bokes duell & we
                    þerfore…
OxfWad13.Last Lines:
…Where resteth loue and alle peesOure ioye may be endles
                    Amen
OxfWad13.Note:
Eight books and Prologue; 3 leaves missing; Followed by six Latin verses
                    beginning, ‘Explicit iste liber qui transeat obsecro liber’;
                    Followed by, ‘Epistola super huius opusculi siue complementum Iohanni
                        Gower a quoddam philosopho transmissa’ followed on ff.
                        442v-446v by ‘Traitie pour essampler les
                        Amantz marietz’ in French imperfect at the end.
